p: Citral exhibited antimicrobial activity against pathogenic and food-spoilage bacteria such as E. coli O157:H7, Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium, Listeria monocytogenes, and Staphylococcus aureus [ 111, 112]. This compund disrupts and penetrates the lipid structure of the cell wall of bacteria. It leads to protein denaturation and destruction of the cell membrane, followed by cytoplasmic leakage, cell lysis and death [ 113]. Citral was reported in the EO of L. alba (citral chemotype).
